content.description: This Prattville moderate was bolted thanks to community donations. Boulder up to the first bolt, then continue past another bolt and finish slightly up/right to the super shut anchors
content.protection: 2 bolts + anchors equipped for lowering. Lead bolts and anchors were placed in November 2018
content.location: Easiest bolted route on the Pratt Wall, directly uphill from the boulder.

content.description: Shares its first bolt with Freak Show. Start on the questionable flake below the roof, climb up/right past the first bolt to 2 more bolts to anchors equipped for lowering
content.protection: 3 bolts + anchors. Lead bolts and anchors replaced in March 2018 thanks to the ASCA (safeclimbing.org)
content.location: The right side of the Small Wall that faces north. N of the main boulder

content.description: To the right of Lean Crack on Pratt’s Wall. Start below the mineral deposit feature, climbing up over it and traversing right diagonally somewhat as you near the top (don’t hurt the sapling growing out of the rock face). Free Solo-able for sure. For safety, you could set up a TR anchor up top.
content.location: Look for the mineral deposit feature. It’s hard to miss.

content.description: This route starts below a one bolt anchor at the top of the boulder on the south side. Pass a bulge.
content.location: Located between melted stone and before man.

content.description: Three feet east of melted stone.
content.location: Three feet east of melted stone.

content.description: Tulsa Sport Revival. This Prattville moderate was bolted thanks to community donations. Start on the left arete and climb up to the second bolt, then make a challenging move up/right to reach the 3rd bolt, then continue up/right to the anchor shared with Community Angle.
content.protection: 3 bolts + anchors. Stainless placed in November 2018.
content.location: Located next to the left arete of the Boulder Wall (east side of the Pratt Boulder) that faces the bluffline.

content.description: Follow the vertical line of bolts to a cryptic finish. Starts just left of a large tree with a thin crack that leads to a very pocketed section of wall, and then a less featured finish past the last bolt to the horizontals up top.
content.protection: 3 bolts to ring anchors (all SS 12mm Petzl wedge bolts)
content.location: Center of the Boulder Wall (E face of the Pratt Boulder). Just left of the large tree.

content.description: Fright Wall’s first linkup!Climb up The Thing (1982) to the knob and clip its second bolt. After that, move directly up/left making a big move to the jug, clip the 3rd bolt of The Blackout (1985), and finish on it.
content.location: Fright Wall, north of the Pratt Boulder

content.description: The middle of the 3 original lines on the Fright Wall. 10ft right of the blunt arete. Directly below the 2 bolt glue-in anchor
content.protection: 3 bolts + anchor. Lead bolts were replaced in a January 2019 and top anchor bolts were replaced in March 2018 thanks to the ASCA (safeclimbing.org)
content.location: Fright Wall

content.description: Route on the north end of the boulder
content.protection: 2 bolts + anchors equipped for lowering. Lead bolts and anchors were replaced in March 2018 thanks to the ASCA (safeclimbing.org)
content.location: Pratt Boulder

content.description: Easy climbing on small sharp pockets to a crux approximately 3/4 of the way up. There are a lot of gear options and the crux is very protectable.
content.location: Look for a large detached looking block at the South end of Pratt's wall. Start under the (climber's) left end of the block and finish straight over the block. Left of Whispering Caterpillar and right of Warren's Way.

content.description: Hard face and pocket climbing
content.protection: Webbing for TR, or it can likely be TR’d off the anchor for Whispering Caterpillar
content.location: On the Pratt Wall, 5-10ft left of Pratt Dihedral

content.description: This route was known as the hardest tried line of the area in the late 80's and was bolted and led by Patrick Huntley in 1990. This route starts on pockets a few feet right of the obvious thin to wide crack known as "Robo crack." Overcome a bulge to a direct finish to the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts + anchors. Replaced in 2020 with SS glue-ins thanks to the ASCA (American Safe Climbing Association)
content.location: This is on the end of the area located near the center of the Robo Wall, a few feet right of robo crack.

content.description: Crack 15ft right of the dihedral that gets increasingly wider.
content.protection: Cams + tree anchor, or use Robotron’s bolt anchor just to the right

content.description: The wide dihedral
content.location: Between the Pratt Wall on the left and the Robo Wall on the right. SE of the Pratt Boulder

content.description: TR that climbs directly to the Freak Show anchor
content.location: Small Wall

content.description: Solution ridges 2-3ft right of Freebie, the crack route
content.location: Dreammaker Wall on the S end of the Pratt Boulder

content.description: Face holds and the thin vertical crack a few feet left of the right arete
content.protection: 3 bolts + bolted anchor. Top anchor was replaced by the ASCA in March 2018. Lead bolts  replaced by the ASCA in 2020/2021.
content.location: 10ft right of Robo Crack, and just south of the Pratt Boulder

content.description: Crimpy knobs lead through a few pockets and edges.
content.location: Left hand knob at head height.

content.description: Wide crack on the Pratt Wall (west facing) directly east of Tall Man’s 5.10 on the boulder
content.location: Pratt Wall

content.description:
Carefully climb up to the huge undercling flake and clip the 1st bolt. From there continue straight up past smaller holds until reaching the 3rd bolt where you find 5.10 terrain to the top.A double length draw pre-hung on the second bolt is recommended so it can be clipped before launching into the crux sequence.

 On the Fright Wall north of the Small Wall and boulder
content.protection: 3 bolts + anchor. Bolts replaced in Feb 2020 thanks to the ASCA (safeclimbing.org)

content.description: “IT” just like the name, it’s short and a great addition to the area. Located 20 feet right of Kendos Only, start on positive holds to a couple are harder moves off less positive holds. Finish on easier terrain to the anchors. The climb starts centered with the bolts and then follows just right of the bolt line. Make sure to add this well protected moderate to the todo list while in the area. Grade should land somewhere between 5.10+/5.11-- range. Don’t come right after a rain, or you might just float down the drain.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Fright wall 5th bolted Line from the left arete of black out. Start is just right of a tree.

content.description: Obvious crack line a few feet right of the SW arete of the Pratt Boulder
content.location: Left end of the Dreammaker Wall on the S end of the Pratt Boulder

content.description: After clipping the first bolt shared with Water World Roof, angle up/left past 3 more bolts to the anchors
content.location: Small Wall north of the Pratt boulder. Directly right of the Fright Wall

content.description: Left facing flake on the slightly slab by wall around the corner (left) from Black Out. This is the furthest left route on The Fright Wall.

This Prattville moderate was bolted thanks to community donations. Start in the middle of the Boulder Wall and find the easiest way up to the first bolt, then follow good features up/left past 2 more bolts to the super shut anchor shared with TSR
content.protection: 3 bolts + anchors equipped for lowering. Lead bolts and anchors were placed in November 2018
content.location: Located in the middle of the Boulder Wall (east side of the Pratt Boulder) that faces the bluffline.

content.description: Climb that follows the blunt arete, but begins 4ft right of the arete. Currently shares anchors with The Thing
content.protection: 3 bolts + anchors equipped for lowering. Lead bolts replaced in April 2018, anchors in Feb 2020, thanks to the ASCA (safeclimbing.org)
content.location: Fright Wall

content.description: This linkup climbs Blackout to the plant jug (clipping all 3 bolts), then moves right to clip The Thing’s last bolt and climb its final crux. A thinner finish than Blackout.
content.location: Fright wall.

content.description: Climb to the mini-roof, then up/left to the anchors
content.protection: The old 2 bolts have been removed and are scheduled to be replaced soon. The anchor shared with the adjacent route was replaced thanks to the ASCA in Nov 2018
content.location: On the S end of the Pratt Boulder in the middle of the wall. Starts a couple feet right of the large tree

content.description: Climb the arete by freebie. This has a nice "creek" view and cool position. Protect with TR.
content.location: Obvious corner arete by Freebie and creek.

content.description: Above the drainage ditch, 4 feet left of the SW corner of the Pratt Boulder. Always water below the start

This area is in the drainage ditch of Hwy 97 on the East side. This area is in the drainage flood pain so it can be wet depending on the last time it rained. This area is also home to very difficult routes.Prattville is believed to be public property, but please be considerate of the neighbors if you park in the neighborhood and ensure you aren’t blocking any driveways. If you park at the dead end of S Linwood Dr. in the neighboorhood, either be at the dead end and out of the way of the nearby driveway or along the west edge of the street.
